column4: Anyone know how to get alsa working?   Failed to construct test pipeline for 'ALSA - Advanced Linux Sound Architecture'
is esd running?
System>Preferences>Multimedia Systems Selector>Default Sink>ESD>Test
the esd and oss tests work
do you know how I could fix this?
sorry, I was busy
ok, so did that test succeed?
the esd and oss tests work
ok, and was your problem with xmms originally?
I never used xmms. Its for getting a game to run and apparently it does if it uses alsa instead of oss
xmms works
ok, so your game requires direct alsa access?
if so, simply killing esd before starting your game should suffice.
Isaw that posted elsewhere but it doesn't work. And I actually run the game inside a chroot.
shouldn't I be supposed to be able to select alsa in the multimedia switcher?
yes, does it not work?
no I get a Failed to construct test pipeline for 'ALSA - Advanced Linux Sound Architecture'
ah, interesting.
ok, please paste the output of the following commands to http://pastebin.com: lsmod, lspci -v, lspnp, dmesg, cat /proc/asound/modules, cat /proc/asound/cards
(lspci if your sound card is pci, lspnp if it's isa)
should I do all this only outside the chroot?
wherever you're experiencing the problem
ok
ping me when the url's up
I sent what you asked?
sorry, I didn't see the url
http://pastebin.com/269821
thanks, sec
ok, and amixer output?
amixer in there
thanks, sec
interesting. Nothing in there leads me to believe ALSA _shouldn't_ be working. Does aplay -Dplughw:0,0 foo.wav work?
(after you kill esd)
it works
ok, so your issue is related to the chroot->alsa stuff, which I'm not terribly familiar with
I believe it's related to the use of hw:0,0 directly
will have to investigate, I don't know offhand
snd_seq_device  is what the game complains about
hmm, that the sequencer stuff
and I tried a Point2Play hardware test outside the chroot too with the same failure
sudo modprobe snd-seq
then what?
try again
ALSA lib seq_hw.c:462:(snd_seq_hw_open) SNDRV_SEQ_IOCTL_PVERSION failed: Invalid argument is what cedega gives me
ok, I'm not familiar with that one, and nothing's turning up in mantis
what's mantis?
it's ALSA's bug tracking system
ko
would uninstalling alsa, esd, oss then installing alsa again help?
no
Thanks alot for your help a while ago. I hope I'll be able to figure out a solution
np, g'luck
what's the problem with via integrateD?
you remember my problem last night? I think its via specific
I'm sorry, but I don't. I haven't slept, and I have a horrid memory.
refresh, please?
see https://bugzilla.ubuntu.com/show_bug.cgi?id=6303  https://bugzilla.ubuntu.com/show_bug.cgi?id=8529
My alsa is not working for a game through cedega
aplay works however but I think I need a  /dev/snd/seq  which I dont have
I'm not sure what the latter bug report has to do with sound...
the former has been resolved upstream; did you toggle the iec958 capture monitor?
could you tell a command to  reload alsa without rebooting to test changes to  /etc/modutils/alsa-base   ?
sudo /etc/init.d/alsa force-reload
changes should not be made to /etc/modutils/alsa-base but to /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base
I don't have a iec958 capture monitor in alsamixer
yeah I knew that
And wasn't able to fix the problem and I think I don't have the exact same hardware  (bug is for rev 50 and I have rev 60)  The second bug is relevant because what  am missing is /dev/snd/seq
the bug affects all cmi9761s
regardless of revision
the second bug takes me to a mozilla-firefox issue
https://bugzilla.ubuntu.com/show_bug.cgi?id=8529
that issue seems to have been worked around...
but the fix dosen't work for me
that's because that's completely different from your issue
your issue is that the wrong parameters are being passed, not that the node doesn't exist
I'm outa my league here
if you have a _lot_ of RAM (i.e., >= 768 MB), try an i386 live cd
the module snd_seq_device is loaded but I don't have a /dev/snd/seq   device
I had thought of that... I'll try it
last question: do you think I should have a /dev/snd/seq  ?
if you sudo modprobe snd-seq, you should be fine.
/usr/share/applications/*.desktop
/usr/share/pixmaps/*  for the icons, usually
thanks. menu-editor is still buggy
maybe you can help:   Open Office 1.1.3 used to run but now it segfaults. I don't know how I broke it
sorry, not an OO.o person. Have you checked bugzilla?
yeah and I did'nt find anything
no, you munged the syntax
sorry
/var/log/dmesg ?
or do you want all the lsb output, too?
where do I submit a bug report for a universe package? (streamtuner)
launchpad.ubuntu.com/malone
